item.title: teaching
item.description: Teaching Assistant: Fall 2017 and 2019, CS5785 Applied Machine Learning. Fall 2016, CS4320 Introduction to Database Systems.

item.title: Miscellaneous
item.description: Here are some interesting facts about myself: I am an amateur Go player and a member of the Cornell Go Club. During 2016-2018, I participated in ACGL (American Collegiate Go League), representing Cornell University. I am (officially) a 2-dan amateur Go player and a 4-dan player on Eweiqi. I read books in my spare time, especially science fictions, history, and philosophy books. I am particularly interested in analytic philosophy, philosophy of language and philosophy of mind.

item.title: PointFlow : 3D Point Cloud Generation with Continuous Normalizing Flows
Controllable Video Generation with Sparse Trajectories
Arbitrary Style Transfer in Real-time with Adaptive Instance Normalization

about
item.description: About Welcome to my homepage! My name is Xun Huang (黄勋 in Chinese, pronounced as /shuun hwang/). I am a fourth-year PhD student in the Department of Computer Science at Cornell University, affiliated with Cornell Tech at NYC. I am advised by Professor Serge Belongie. My research is focused on deep generative models and applying them to re-create the visual world. My research has been supported by Adobe Research Fellowship (2019), Snap Research Fellowship (2019), and NVIDIA Graduate Fellowship (2018).

item.title: SALICON: Reducing the Semantic Gap in Saliency Prediction by Adapting Deep Neural Networks
